title: The Makefile should be modified
body:
There should be `$(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/include/bamtools` instead of `$(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/include`:
```
Rseq_bam_stats:
	@mkdir -p $(PREFIX)/$(BIN)
	@echo "* compiling" $(SOURCE_STA)
	@$(CXX) $(SRC)/$(SOURCE_STA) -o $(PREFIX)/$(BIN)/$(STA) $(BAMFLAGS) $(CXXFLAGS) $(LBFLAGS) $(BOOSTFLAGS) -I $(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/include/bamtools -I $(ZLIB_ROOT)/include/ -I $(BOOST_ROOT)/include/ -L $(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/lib/ -L $(ZLIB_ROOT)/lib/ -L $(BOOST_ROOT)/lib/

mappingFlankingVariants:
	@echo "* compiling" $(SOURCE_MFV)
	@$(CXX) $(SRC)/$(SOURCE_MFV) -o $(PREFIX)/$(BIN)/$(MFV) $(BAMFLAGS) $(CXXFLAGS) $(LBFLAGS) $(BOOSTFLAGS) -I $(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/include/bamtools -I $(ZLIB_ROOT)/include/ -I $(BOOST_ROOT)/include/ -L $(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/lib/ -L $(ZLIB_ROOT)/lib/ -L $(BOOST_ROOT)/lib/

novelSnvFilter_ACGT:
	@echo "* compiling" $(SOURCE_REC)
	@$(CXX) $(SRC)/$(SOURCE_REC) -o $(PREFIX)/$(BIN)/$(REC) $(BAMFLAGS) $(CXXFLAGS) $(LBFLAGS) $(BOOSTFLAGS) -I $(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/include/bamtools -I $(ZLIB_ROOT)/include/ -I $(BOOST_ROOT)/include/ -L $(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/lib/ -L $(ZLIB_ROOT)/lib/ -L $(BOOST_ROOT)/lib/

grep_starts:
	@echo "* compiling" $(SOURCE_GS)
	@$(CXX) $(SRC)/$(SOURCE_GS) -o $(PREFIX)/$(BIN)/$(GS) $(BAMFLAGS) $(CXXFLAGS) $(LBFLAGS) $(BOOSTFLAGS) -I $(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/include/bamtools -I $(ZLIB_ROOT)/include/ -I $(BOOST_ROOT)/include/ -L $(BAMTOOLS_ROOT)/lib/ -L $(ZLIB_ROOT)/lib/ -L $(BOOST_ROOT)/lib/
```
If not, it will report error:
```
novelSnvFilter_ACGT.cpp:14:10: fatal error: api/BamReader.h: No such file or directory
   14 | #include <api/BamReader.h>
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
make: *** [Makefile:37: novelSnvFilter_ACGT] Error 1
```


Best,
Duo

title: Use the protocol for mouse genome
body:
Hi all, 

So is there any precompiled annotation file four mouse genome mm10? If not, is there a clear protocol how to adapt mouse genome to your pipeline? 

Thanks alot,

title: How to perform WGS data analysis instead of WES data?
body:
I see the config files for [WES](https://github.com/SunPathLab/ith.Variant/tree/main/confs/exome) but didn't see the config files for WGS.

Thank you!

Best,
Duo
